bibl.title: An Egyptian Interpretation of Alexander's Elephant Headdress.
bibl.note: The depiction of Alexander the Great in an elephant headdress on tetradrachms of early Hellenistic Egypt may recall the Syrian elephant hunt of the New Kingdom pharaoh Tutmose III, a great conqueror in Asia. Alexander was associated with Tutmose III in the temple of Amun-Ra at Karnak. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Catharine C. Lorber, An Egyptian Interpretation of Alexander's Elephant Headdress.

The depiction of Alexander the Great in an elephant headdress on tetradrachms of early Hellenistic Egypt may recall the Syrian elephant hunt of the New Kingdom pharaoh Tutmose III, a great conqueror in Asia. Alexander was associated with Tutmose III in the temple of Amun-Ra at Karnak. - Avec résumé en anglais.
